intro: Pourthiaea villosa, commonly known as the woolly pourthiaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance and resilience.
